New Records: The Cavaliers became the first team in NBA history to win their first 10 games and score at least 110 points in each of them.
Cleveland also set a franchise record with a 41-point halftime lead at 83-42 — tying the eighth largest in the NBA’s shot clock era
Key Match Events: Garland made a pair of 3-pointers and Mobley scored six points as the Cavaliers grabbed a 20-2 lead.
Golden State missed eight of its first nine field goal attempts and Green picked up two fouls in the first 5:39.
Post-Match Reflections: Jonathan Kuminga scored 21 points and Stephen Curry had 12 points and six turnovers for Golden State, which lost for the first time in six road games this season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The matchup was the 21st time in NBA history that a team with an undefeated road record played an unbeaten home team, minimum four games for each.
Others: Donovan Mitchell was limited to 12 points, missing nine of his 13 field goal attempts and committing four turnovers.
The Cavaliers host Brooklyn on Saturday night.
